content:
Looking for help formatting dates for feeds module.
https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/how-do-i-import-dates-feeds-module
I'm doing this by exporting a date field from D7 as a custom format: U (i.e. Unix timestamp). Works fine for me.

So, I'm creating the dates in a spreadsheet to import them. I've found that I may have to convert them all to Unix first. Early experiments are working and I've found a tool that does batch conversions to UNIX for me.
Of course, it took some experiments to get the dates in a format that the batch conversion tool will understand.
Well, I got them in. But, it was a bit of a hassle. Will be easier next time

@StPaulTim have you created the spreadsheet manually, or using views and https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/views_data_export? If the latter, then you could have formatted the date field in your view to use Unix timestamps:

backdrop-contrib/views_data_export
Views Data Export. Contribute to backdrop-contrib/views_data_export development by creating an account on GitHub.
...I believe that this is what @BWPanda was referring to.
...that would have resulted in your spreadsheet having the dates in Unix timestamp to begin with, so no conversion would have been necessary.
@klonos - no, my problem was that I was importing bulk data generated by hand, not coming from anywhere else. You'll see what I'm talking about later today.
